fields.value: Program and Enrollments File:  Postsecondary Career School Survey, 1981:  [United States]

authorName.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This survey collected data from postsecondary institutions  offering vocational education programs. This data file provides  detailed informati
on on the individual program offerings of the  responding institutions, including enrollments and completions in  various program categories and other outcomes. Information such as  school name, city, ZIP code, sampling weight, and institutional and program characteristics are also contained in the file.

fields.value: Version Date: 2004-06-10Version Text: 2004-06-10 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Card Image with SAS and SPSS data definition statements;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) This data collection does not contain records for  schools considered active that did not respond to the survey (656  schools in this category were included in national tabulations based  on imputed values). As a result, unweighted tabulations on all  noncorrespondence schools will not match figures published by  NCES. The sample survey did not include flight schools and other  schools in the sampling frame. Nevertheless, long forms may be present  in the file for such schools if they were located in a state  requesting a special survey. Correspondence school data elements and  long form staffing variables were not imputed if missing. Long form  and short form programs and enrollments data were imputed if missing.  (2) This study has different card types and segments and for this  reason the number of records might vary for each case. There are also  three different Form Types for the study, FORM 1 is the short form  with 5,307 cases, FORM 2 is the long form with 1,675 cases, and FORM 3  is the Correspondence schools with 62 cases. (3) The codebook is  provided by ICPSR as a Portable Document Format (PDF) file. The PDF  file format was developed by Adobe Systems Incorporated and can be  accessed using PDF reader software, such as the Adobe Acrobat Reader.  Information on how to obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided on the ICPSR Web site.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;
